usefulItems: baking paper, springform cake tin (26 cm), large bowl, wooden skewer, oven, refrigerator
title: Hazelnut torte

ingredients.content: 250 g hazelnuts, plus extra for decorating

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a springform cake tin (26 cm) and set aside.
Place raw sugar into mixing bowl and mill <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place hazelnuts into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl to the sugar and set aside. Thoroughly clean and dry mixing bowl.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b> <b>.<b> Place egg whites and salt into mixing bowl and whip <b>2-4 min/speed 3.5<b> <b>until stiff peaks form. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>. Transfer whipped egg whites into a large bowl and set aside.
Place egg yolks, water and reserved sugar into mixing bowl and mix <b>1 min 30 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add cornflour, plain flour, baking powder and reserved hazelnut meal and mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>.

Spoon ⅓ of the reserved egg whites back into mixing bowl and whip <b>5-10 sec//speed 2<b>. Transfer mix into large bowl with remaining egg whites and gently fold together using a metal spoon until all is combined, taking care not to overwork the mix. Pour into prepared springform tin and bake for 50 minutes (180°C) or until a wooden skewer inserted into centre of the cake comes out clean. Allow cake to cool (approx. 1 hour). Clean and dry mixing bowl.

hintsAndTricks: The time it takes your filling mix to thicken in step 9 will depend on the cream used. If you would prefer larger amounts of filling between the layers of torte, make two separate batches as per recipe above.
<b>Gluten free torte:<b> replace 40 g plain flour with 40 g gluten free cornflour and proceed as per recipe.
